sources.data_found: CCI documentation list of available systems: AiMOS (DCS) has 16 nodes with 4x V100-16GB and 252 nodes with 6x V100-32GB; NPL has 40 nodes with 8x V100-32GB; NGH has 2 nodes with 1x H100 96GB (GraceHopper) each.
AiMOS (DCS) details: 268 nodes total; 16 nodes have 4x NVIDIA Tesla V100 (16GB); 252 nodes have 6x NVIDIA Tesla V100 (32GB).
NPL cluster details: 40 nodes; each node has 8x NVIDIA Tesla V100 (32 GiB).
NGH cluster details: 2 nodes; each node has 1x Nvidia Arm GraceHopper Superchip with 1x H100 GPU with 96GB HBM3e.

FOCI/IDEA Cluster Details (Jul 2025): overall described as having Nvidia Ampere A100 GPUs; node inventory shows idea-node-06 has 1x GPU and idea-node-07 has 1x GPU (GPU model/memory size not specified per-node).

student_data.notes: On the RPI Computer Science B.S. program page, the page explicitly includes the label "2024 -2025 CS Catalog Information" and states the CS major "currently have[s] over 1400 undergraduates." Because the figure is phrased as "over 1400" (not an exact headcount), undergrad_cs_count is set to 1400 as a lower bound. I did not find any explicit 2024/2024-2025/Fall 2024 headcount numbers for M.S.-only or Ph.D.-only CS students on publicly accessible pages; the department links to a CS Graduate Program Guide hosted on Box, but the Box share page requires JavaScript and could not be accessed in this environment, so grad_cs_count and phd_cs_count are set to 0.

gpu_resources.notes:
Clusters included:

1) CCI AiMOS (DCS):
- 16 nodes × 4 V100 = 64 V100
- 252 nodes × 6 V100 = 1512 V100
AiMOS subtotal V100 = 64 + 1512 = 1576

2) CCI NPL:
- 40 nodes × 8 V100 = 320 V100

Total V100 across CCI (AiMOS + NPL) = 1576 + 320 = 1896 V100

3) CCI NGH (GraceHopper):
- 2 nodes × 1 GraceHopper Superchip = 2 GH200-class systems
Counted as gh200_count=2 (not also counted under h100_sxm_count/h100_pcie_count to avoid double-counting the embedded H100 GPU).

4) FOCI/IDEA Cluster (Jul 2025):
- idea-node-06: 1 GPU
- idea-node-07: 1 GPU
Total GPUs = 2; cluster described as using Nvidia Ampere A100 GPUs, but memory size is not specified. Assumed A100 40GB for counting purposes: a100_40gb_count += 2.

No evidence found in these sources for A100 80GB, H100 PCIe/SXM (standalone), H200, A6000, L40S, A40, P100 at the central RPI clusters listed above.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
validation_notes: No changes made. All GPUs appear to be locally owned. Student data remains as is, with grad/PhD counts at 0 as per source.
